overview:
## Discussion

If `setObjectValue:` is called with an `NSURL` object, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathCell/clickedPathComponentCell] is automatically called. The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/objectValue] method returns the most recently set URL value. The `setObjectValue:` method can also take a string value, with the items separated by the path separator (`/`). Any other value is a programming error and will cause an assertion.

# setObjectValue(_:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the receiver’s object value.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func setObjectValue(_ obj: (any NSCopying)?)
```

## Parameters

- **obj**: The new object value for the cell.

## Discussion

If `setObjectValue:` is called with an `NSURL` object, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathCell/clickedPathComponentCell] is automatically called. The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/objectValue] method returns the most recently set URL value. The `setObjectValue:` method can also take a string value, with the items separated by the path separator (`/`). Any other value is a programming error and will cause an assertion.
title: setObjectValue(_:)
